Related Publications

Related Publications

For more information on the Machine Perceptions Primitives contained in NMPT, please refer to the following publications.

Fast Saliency Using Natural-statistics

  • Nicholas J. Butko, Lingyun Zhang, Garrison W. Cottrell, and Javier R. Movellan, “Visual Saliency Model for Robot Cameras”, Proceedings of the 2008 IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA), pp. 2398–2403, Pasadena, CA, USA, May 19–23, 2008 http://mplab.ucsd.edu/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/icra2008.pdf
  • Lingyun Zhang, Matthew H. Tong, Timothy K. Marks, Honghao Shan, and Garrison W. Cottrell, "SUN: A Bayesian Framework for SaliencyUsing Natural Statistics." Journal of Vision, 2008. http://www-cse.ucsd.edu/~gary/pubs/Zhang-et-al-2008-accepted.pdf

MIPOMDP

  • Nicholas J. Butko and Javier R. Movellan, "Optimal Scanning for Faster Object Detection", Proceedings of the 2009 IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR), 2009. http://mplab.ucsd.edu/wp-content/uploads/2139.pdf
  • Nicholas J. Butko and Javier R. Movellan, "I-POMDP: An Infomax Model of Eye Movement", Proceedings of the International Conference on Development and Learning (ICDL) 2008. http://mplab.ucsd.edu/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/icdl2008.pdf
  • Jiri Najemnik and Wilson S. Geisler, "Optimal eye movment strategies in visual search", Nature, 434, 387-391, 2005.

Object Search

  • Ian R. Fasel, "Learning Real-Time Detectors: Probabilistic Generative Approaches," Ph.D. Thesis, UC San Diego, 2006.
